title: Downloading Filtered Tableau Images with Super Sample Superstore
text: vignette demonstrates usage download_filtered_tableau_image function R package. ’ll use Super Sample Superstore example Tableau showcase download filtered images filtering various combinations region category.
code: library(vvtableau)  # Authenticate on the Tableau Server. tableau <- authenticate_server(   server = "https://tableau.server.com",   username = "your_username",   password = "your_password" )  # Set the view ID for the Super Sample Superstore example view view_id <- "super-sample-superstore-view-id"  # Set the path to save the downloaded images path_to_save <- "path/to/save/images/"

title: Downloading Filtered Tableau Images with Super Sample Superstore
text: Let’s download images different combinations region category filters. example, function iterate row dataframe download filtered images combination region category. case, download images following combinations: “West” region, “Furniture” category “East” region, “Technology” category “Central” region, “Office Supplies” category can customize filter_df dataframe include combinations region category filters needed.
code: # Create a dataframe with the filter values for each combination filter_df <- data.frame(   region = c("West", "East", "Central"),   category = c("Furniture", "Technology", "Office Supplies") )  download_filtered_tableau_image(tableau, filter_df, view_id, path_to_save)

title: Getting Started
text: vvtableau package provides interface interacting Tableau Server using Tableau REST API. vignette walk main functionalities package, demonstrating authenticate, retrieve information, perform various operations Tableau Server.

title: Getting Started
text: begin, need authenticate establish connection Tableau Server. Use authenticate_server() function provide server URL, username, password. ’s example: authentication succeeded tableau object can passed Tableau REST API methods.

title: Getting Started
text: connected, can retrieve various information Tableau Server using provided functions. example retrieve jobs server:

title: Getting Started
text: vignette covered basic functionalities vvtableau package, including authentication, retrieving server information, publishing workbooks, managing users groups, downloading workbooks views. complete list functions parameters, please refer package documentation. Please note vignette serves brief introduction package capabilities. detailed instructions examples, consult package documentation explore individual function documentation. hope find vvtableau package helpful automating Tableau workflows enhancing Tableau Server experience!

title: Authors and Citation
text: Tomer Iwan. Author, maintainer. Ruben Korvinus. Contributor. VU Analytics. Copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Iwan T (2024). vvtableau: R Interface 'Tableau' Services. R package version 0.3.0,  https://vusaverse.github.io/vvtableau/, https://github.com/vusaverse/vvtableau.
code: @Manual{,   title = {vvtableau: R Interface for 'Tableau' Services},   author = {Tomer Iwan},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.3.0,  https://vusaverse.github.io/vvtableau/},   url = {https://github.com/vusaverse/vvtableau}, }

title: R Interface for Tableau Services
text: vvtableau package R interface interacting Tableau Server using Tableau REST API. provides convenient way automate Tableau tasks, publishing workbooks, refreshing data extracts, managing users groups, retrieving information server objects directly R. Additionally, includes functions download filtered views, workbooks, export different formats like PDF PowerPoint. Furthermore, methods included interact Tableau desktop. methods allow retrieve information workbooks change .

title: R Interface for Tableau Services
text: see functions available section based Tableau REST API, helper functions, functions work local Tableau workbooks using XML structure, please refer reference page vvtableau package. reference page provides comprehensive list functions available package, organized category. Additionally, package includes vignettes provide detailed information use functions package.

title: R Interface for Tableau Services
text: can install tableauR package GitHub using devtools package: package also available CRAN:

title: R Interface for Tableau Services
text: Contributions vvtableau welcome! encounter bugs, feature requests, like contribute code improvements, please open issue submit pull request GitHub repository.

what: Authenticate to Tableau Server or Tableau Cloud — authenticate_PAT
title: Authenticate to Tableau Server or Tableau Cloud — authenticate_PAT
text: function authenticates Tableau Server Tableau Cloud using personal access token (PAT).

title: Authenticate to Tableau Server or Tableau Cloud — authenticate_PAT
code: authenticate_PAT(   pat_name,   pat_secret,   content_url,   base_url,   api_version = 3.4 )

title: Authenticate to Tableau Server or Tableau Cloud — authenticate_PAT
text: pat_name name personal access token (PAT). pat_secret secret personal access token (PAT). content_url URL content authenticate. Tableau Server, typically URL Tableau server followed site ID. Tableau Cloud, usually URL Tableau cloud workbook. base_url base URL Tableau server Tableau cloud. Tableau Server, usually URL Tableau server. Tableau Cloud, usually URL Tableau cloud, must contain pod name, 10az, 10ay, us-east-1. example, base URL sign site 10ay pod : https://10ay.online.tableau.com. api_version api version use. Default 3.4

title: Authenticate to Tableau Server or Tableau Cloud — authenticate_PAT
text: list containing base URL, access token, site ID, user ID.

text: list containing authentication variables: base_url, token, site_id, user_id.

title: Update Group — update_group
text: Updates group Tableau Server Tableau Cloud site.

title: Update Group — update_group
code: update_group(   tableau,   group_id,   group_name = NULL,   AD_group_name = NULL,   AD_domain = NULL,   minimum_site_role = NULL,   license_mode = NULL,   on_demand_access = NULL,   asJob = FALSE,   api_version = 3.19 )

title: Update Group — update_group
text: tableau list containing Tableau authentication variables: `base_url`, `token`, `site_id`. group_id ID group update. group_name new name group (optional). AD_group_name name Active Directory group synchronize (optional). AD_domain domain Active Directory group (optional). minimum_site_role Required import element grantLicenseMode attribute present request. site role assigned users imported Active Directory granted license automatically using grant license -sync -login mode. license_mode Optional. mode automatically applying licenses group members. mode onLogin, license granted group member log site. on_demand_access Optional. boolean value used enable -demand access embedded Tableau content Tableau Cloud site licensed Embedded Analytics usage-based model. asJob Boolean value indicating whether synchronize Active Directory background task (true) synchronize immediately (false). Default false. api_version API version use (default: 3.19).

title: Update Group — update_group
text: TRUE operation successful, FALSE otherwise.

text: Modifies information specified user.

title: Update User — update_user
text: tableau list containing Tableau authentication variables: `base_url`, `token`, `site_id`. user_id ID user update. fullName new name user (optional). email new email address user (optional). password new password user (optional). siteRole new site role assign user. authSetting authentication type user (optional). api_version API version use (default: 3.19).

title: Update User — update_user
text: TRUE operation successful, FALSE otherwise.

title: vvtableau 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-10-31 Added function authenticate Tableau Server Tableau Cloud using personal access token.

title: vvtableau 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-07-17

title: vvtableau 0.2.0
text: Deprecated base_url, site_id, token arguments favor tableau argument get_server_workbooks function. Users now required pass tableau object returned authenticate_tableau_server function authentication. Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
